pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing suspension
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:0.4: 2. The training rule on physical contact
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.2: At that time Venerable Udāyī was staying in the wilderness.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.3: He had a beautiful dwelling with a room in the middle and corridors on all sides.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.4: The bed and bench were nicely made up,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.5: and the water for drinking and the water for washing were ready for use.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.7: Many people came to see Udāyī’s dwelling,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.8: among them a certain brahmin and his wife. They approached Udāyī and said,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.9: “Venerable, we would like to see your dwelling.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.11: Udāyī took the key, lifted the latch, opened the door, and entered the dwelling.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.14: Opening some windows and closing others, Udāyī walked around the inner room and came up behind the brahmin lady, touching her all over.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.15: Then the brahmin thanked Udāyī and left.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.17: “These Sakyan monastics who live in the wilderness are superb.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.21: He touched me all over just like you do.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.22: The brahmin then complained and criticized him,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.23: “These Sakyan monastics are shameless and immoral liars.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.24: They claim to have integrity, to be celibate and of good conduct, to be truthful, moral, and good.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.25: But they don’t have the good character of a monastic or a brahmin.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.27: How could the ascetic Udāyī touch my wife all over?
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.28: It’s not possible to go to a monastery or a monk’s dwelling with a wife from a respectable family, or with a daughter, a girl, a daughter-in-law, or a female slave from a respectable family.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.29: If you do, the Sakyan monastics might molest them.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.2.1: The monks heard the criticism of that brahmin.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.2.2: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.2.3: “How could Venerable Udāyī make physical contact with a woman?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.2.5: He then had the Sangha gathered and questioned Udāyī:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.2.6: “Is it true, Udāyī, that you did this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.2.9: “Foolish man, it’s not suitable, it’s not proper, it’s not worthy of a monastic, it’s not allowable, it’s not to be done.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.2.11: Haven’t I given many teachings for the sake of dispassion, not for the sake of passion …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.2.12: the stilling of the fevers of sensual pleasure?
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.2.14: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.2.15.1: ‘If a monk, overcome by lust and with a distorted mind, makes physical contact with a woman—holding her hand or hair, or touching any part of her body—he commits an offense entailing suspension.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:2.1.4: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:2.1.6: having lust, longing for, in love with.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:2.1.11: But in this case “distorted” refers to the lustful mind.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:2.1.13: a human female, not a female spirit, not a female ghost, not a female animal; even a girl born on that very day, let alone an older one.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:2.1.19: from the elbow to the tip of the nails.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:2.1.21: just the hair; or the hair with strings in it, with a garland, with gold coins, with gold, with pearls, or with gems.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:2.1.23: anything apart from the hand and the hair is called “any part of her body”.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:2.2.1: Physical contact, touching, stroking downwards, stroking upwards, pulling down, lifting up, pulling, pushing, squeezing, pressing, taking hold of, contacting.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:2.2.19: taking hold of a bodily part and then pressing.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:2.2.26: He commits an offense entailing suspension:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:2.2.27: … Therefore, too, it is called “an offense entailing suspension”.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.0.3: Making direct contact with a single person or animal: body to body
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.1: It is a woman, he perceives her as a woman, and he has lust.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.2: If the monk makes physical contact with the woman, body to body, if he touches her, strokes her downwards, strokes her upwards, pulls her down, lifts her up, pulls her, pushes her, squeezes her, presses her, takes hold of her, contacts her, he commits an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.3: It is a woman, but he is unsure of it, and he has lust.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.4: If the monk makes physical contact with the woman, body to body, if he touches her …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.5: takes hold of her, contacts her, he commits a serious offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.6: It is a woman, but he perceives her as a _paṇḍaka_, and he has lust.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.7: If the monk makes physical contact with the woman, body to body, if he touches her …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.8: takes hold of her, contacts her, he commits a serious offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.9: It is a woman, but he perceives her as a man, and he has lust.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.10: If the monk makes physical contact with the woman, body to body, if he touches her …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.11: takes hold of her, contacts her, he commits a serious offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.12: It is a woman, but he perceives her as an animal, and he has lust.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.13: If the monk makes physical contact with the woman, body to body, if he touches her …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.14: takes hold of her, contacts her, he commits a serious offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.15: It is a _paṇḍaka_, he perceives him as a _paṇḍaka_, and he has lust.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.16: If the monk makes physical contact with the _paṇḍaka_, body to body, if he touches him …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.17: takes hold of him, contacts him, he commits a serious offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.18: It is a _paṇḍaka_, but he is unsure of it, and he has lust.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.19: If the monk makes physical contact with the _paṇḍaka_, body to body, if he touches him …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.20: takes hold of him, contacts him, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.21: It is a _paṇḍaka_, but he perceives him as a man, and he has lust.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.22: If the monk makes physical contact with the _paṇḍaka_, body to body, if he touches him …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.23: takes hold of him, contacts him, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.24: It is a _paṇḍaka_, but he perceives him as an animal, and he has lust.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.25: If the monk makes physical contact with the _paṇḍaka_, body to body, if he touches him …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.26: takes hold of him, contacts him, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.27: It is a _paṇḍaka_, but he perceives him as a woman, and he has lust.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.28: If the monk makes physical contact with the _paṇḍaka_, body to body, if he touches him …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.29: takes hold of him, contacts him, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.30: It is a man, he perceives him as a man, and he has lust.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.31: If the monk makes physical contact with the man, body to body, if he touches him …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.32: takes hold of him, contacts him, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.33: It is a man, but he is unsure of it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.34: It is a man, but he perceives him as an animal …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.35: It is a man, but he perceives him as a woman …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.36: It is a man, but he perceives him as a _paṇḍaka_, and he has lust.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.37: If the monk makes physical contact with the man, body to body, if he touches him …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.38: takes hold of him, contacts him, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.39: It is an animal, he perceives it as an animal, and he has lust.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.40: If the monk makes physical contact with the animal, body to body, if he touches it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.41: takes hold of it, contacts it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.42: It is an animal, but he is unsure of it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.43: It is an animal, but he perceives it as a woman …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.44: It is an animal, but he perceives it as a _paṇḍaka_ …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.46: but he perceives it as a man, and he has lust.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.47: If the monk makes physical contact with the animal, body to body, if he touches it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.48: takes hold of it, contacts it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.49: The section based on one item is finished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.2.0: Making direct contact with two beings of the same kind: body to body
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.2.1: It is two women, he perceives both as women, and he has lust.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.2.2: If the monk makes physical contact with the two women, body to body, if he touches them …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.2.3: takes hold of them, contacts them, he commits two offenses entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.2.4: It is two women, but he is unsure about both, and he has lust.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.4.22: It is two women, he perceives both as women, and he has lust.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.4.24: takes hold of them, contacts them, he commits two offenses of wrong conduct. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.4.25: It is a woman and a _paṇḍaka_, but he perceives both as women, and he has lust.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.5.0: Others making direct contact with a monk: body to body
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.5.1: It is a woman, he perceives her as a woman, and he has lust.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.5.2: If the woman makes physical contact with the monk, body to body, if she touches him, strokes him downwards, strokes him upwards, pulls him down, lifts him up, pulls him, pushes him, squeezes him, presses him, takes hold of him, contacts him, and he, aiming at connection, makes an effort with the body and experiences contact, he commits an offense entailing suspension. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.5.3: It is two women, he perceives both as women, and he has lust.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.5.4: If the women make physical contact with the monk, body to body, if they touch him, stroke him downwards, stroke him upwards, pull him down, lift him up, pull him, push him, squeeze him, press him, take hold of him, contact him, and he, aiming at connection, makes an effort with the body and experiences contact, he commits two offenses entailing suspension. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.6.1: If, aiming at connection, he makes an effort with the body and experiences contact, he commits an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.6.2: If, aiming at connection, he makes an effort with the body, but does not experience contact, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.6.3: If, aiming at connection, he makes no effort with the body, but experiences contact, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.6.4: If, aiming at connection, he makes no effort with the body and does not experience contact, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.6.5: If, aiming to free himself, he makes an effort with the body and experiences contact, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.6.6: If, aiming to free himself, he makes an effort with the body, but does not experience contact, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.6.7: If, aiming to free himself, he makes no effort with the body, but experiences contact, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.6.8: If, aiming to free himself, he makes no effort with the body and does not experience contact, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.7.8: if he is overwhelmed by pain;
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.7.9: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.7.17: A staff, pushed with a bowl,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.7.18: When paying respect, made an effort but did not touch.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:4.1.1: At one time a monk touched his mother out of affection.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:4.1.3: “The Buddha has laid down a training rule.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:4.1.4: Could it be that I’ve committed an offense entailing suspension?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:4.1.5: He told the Buddha, who said,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:4.1.7: but there’s an offense of wrong conduct.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:4.1.8: At one time a monk touched his daughter out of affection …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:4.1.12: but there’s an offense of wrong conduct.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:4.2.1: At one time a monk made physical contact with his ex-wife.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:4.3.5: At one time a monk made physical contact with a _paṇḍaka_.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:4.4.1: At one time a monk made physical contact with a sleeping woman.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:4.4.4: At one time a monk made physical contact with a dead woman.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:4.4.8: At one time a monk made physical contact with a female animal.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:4.4.11: but there’s an offense of wrong conduct.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:4.4.12: At one time a monk made physical contact with a wooden doll.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:4.4.15: but there’s an offense of wrong conduct.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:4.5.1: At one time a number of women harassed a monk by leading him about arm in arm.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:4.5.5: “There’s no offense if one doesn’t consent.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:4.6.1: At one time a lustful monk shook the bridge that a woman was standing on.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:4.6.4: but there’s an offense of wrong conduct.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:4.7.1: At one time a monk saw a woman coming in the opposite direction, and being lustful, he struck her with his shoulder.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:4.8.1: At one time a lustful monk shook the tree that a woman had climbed.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:4.8.4: but there’s an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:4.8.8: but there’s an offense of wrong conduct.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:4.9.1: At one time a lustful monk pulled the rope that a woman was holding.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:4.9.5: At one time a lustful monk pulled the staff that a woman was holding.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:4.10.1: At one time a lustful monk pushed a woman with his almsbowl.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:4.11.1: At one time a lustful monk raised his foot as a woman was paying respect to him.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:4.11.4: At one time a monk, thinking, “I’ll take hold of a woman,” exerted himself, but did not make contact.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:4.11.7: but there’s an offense of wrong conduct.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:4.11.8: The training rule on physical contact, the second, is finished.
